alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 9:50PM EDT until March 20 at 10:24AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Black Creek At Quinby affecting Florence and Darlington Counties. For the Black Creek...including Quinby...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Quinby. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Floodwaters spill over into yards of all residences on Creekside Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 11.3 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning.
